text: George Washington was the first president of the United States.
There are 88 keys in a baby grand piano.
Jacques Cousteau is often referred to as 'the father of scuba diving'.
A baby swan is called a cyngnet.
The geyser known as 'Old Faithful' is found in the Yellowstone National Park.
Charles Babbage is credited with inventing the first mechanical computer.
Origami is known as the art of paper folding.
In the John Steinbeck novella 'Of Mice and Men', George murders Lennie.
The Speaker of the House is next in line to succeed the President, after the Vice President.
